title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 16 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: man gets £ 2m after misdiagnosis ends in paralysis .
two further arrests in loughborough murder probe .
shop owner fends off armed robber with wasp spray .
leicester man ruptures throat stifling sneeze .

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear throughout the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: yellow weather warning for snow and ice
text: the met office has issued yellow weather warnings for snow and ice for parts of the east midlands .
a mixture of rain , sleet , snow and hail is likely to cause icy conditions and tricky driving conditions .
this evening will be cold and windy - expect scattered showers .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: man arrested after supermarket altercation
text: a man has been arrested on sus of grievous bodily harm after an altercation at a supermarket in radford .
nottinghamshire police said the altercation occurred at tesco express on alfreton road just after 16:00 yesterday .
one man was taken to the queen 's medical centre with head and body injuries , while the arrested man , 40 , was released while inquiries continue .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: lane reopens in leicester after accident
text: traffic is easing up on burleys flyover .
# leicester travel news/update one lane has now reopened on burleys flyover , from st.georges way , across the flyover towards the station .
all open and running underneath the flyover as well .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: gritting teams to be deployed in leicester
text: temperatures are st to drop tonight , so our # gritting teams will be out in # leicester .
find their routes on our website # grittertwitter
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: busy city route closed because of accident
text: an accident has closed burleys flyover in both directions .
drivers have been told to avoid the area .
# leicester breaking travel news ( sorry for the delay ) there 's been an accident on the burleys flyover .
it is shut in both ways , have arrived at the scene .
please try & avoid the area
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: accident on busy roundabout is causing delays
text: an accident at nottingham knight roundabout is causing traffic backing up towards clifton boulevard .
it is also causing delays to bus services around west bridgford and clifton .
rtc a52 nottingham knight roundabout , avoid area use alternative route
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: cctv shows shop worker chasing armed robber away
text: cctv footage capturing the moment a `` brave '' shop owner used a can of wasp spray to chase away an armed robber has been released by police .
shiyam gunawardena said the attacker pointed a gun at her and demanded money at beeston mini market on chilwell road , in beeston at 11:00 yesterday .
warning : third party content may contain adverts
nottinghamshire police said the masked man pointed a suspected firearm at a member of staff and fled on foot towards imperial road .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: library 'to open as usual ' after small fire
text: firefighters tackled a small blaze at toton library this afternoon .
inspire nottinghamshire libraries said the fire - which started in a bin - was `` minor '' and did n't cause any damage but part of stapleford lane was shut while firefighters put it out .
the library was not due to open today and will open tomorrow as usual
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: forest 's grant staying at notts county
text: forest 's grant staying at notts county

documents.title: roads closed because of snow
text: there are a few road closures in the peak district because of the snow .
snow has forced the closure of a6024 holme moss .
a57 snake pass remains closed .
both routes will stay closed overnight .
a mix of blizzards , drifting snow , ice and hoar frost forecast overnight - particularly on high routes in north of county , but snow could fall to lower levels .
what 's the recommended transpennine route ?
which trunk road is being kept open ?
hi there , we 'll be doing our best to keep as many main routes open as possible but up to 4cm is expected on high ground so conditions may be difficult .
we 'll post another update in the morning & you can check this page too for latest info
so i made it via winnats pass
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: does mp sir desmond swayne nod off in ken clarke 's speech ?
text: conservative mp ken clarke is in full flow here in the house of commons - but what is sir desmond swayne doing behind him ?
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: town 's station work to continue after carillion collapse
text: a major upgrade of market harborough railway station looks set to continue - at least for the time being '' - despite the collapse of main contractor carillion .
work got underway last year creating a new 500-space car park in the town 's rockingham road , to free up space to straighten the midland mainline .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: police constable charged with sex offences
text: a police constable for leicestershire police has been charged with four counts of sexual assault .
the 40-year-old from nottinghamshire appeared at nottingham magistrate 's court today .
leicestershire police said the offences are alleged to have happened in stapleford in july last year .
he is due to appear at nottingham crown court on 13 february .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: mcdermott leaves alfreton town
text: alfreton town have sacked manager john mcdermott after eight months in charge .
the decision follows a disappointing first half of the season which has seen the reds languishing in 18th in the national league north , just one point off the relegation positions .
# atfc can confirm that we have today parted ways with manager john mcdermott with immediate effect .
# atfc

it 's never nice seeing someone lose there job but the club needed to do this before they lost all the remaining supporters well done to the chairman & directors on making this difficult but very important call which may now see us avoid relegation
shame that , best of luck for the future macca .
seemed a really nice man , but football is a result business and they have not been good enough or has there been much improvement , but like to wish you all the best in the future .
@ twitterid
get in @ twitterid
after the boston game the alfreton fans had harsh words about his tactics .
what tactics ?

so pleased spent wasted money going away knowing we was going to lose but fans are fans and they dont come any better than afton 's he has had that many players that could n't get in teams they left just let 's hope mullins stops with us hope he does
could n't see any other way tbh
he 's coming home , he 's coming home , he 's coming , macca 's coming home !
always sad to see someone sacked , but it needed doing .
results and performances have n't been good enough .
need a good appointment now , as the last two managers have been awful
his team relied on crap refereeing on saturday .

got to be better than russle slade

needs a sound core establishing quickly .
good luck all and coyr

documents.title: school raises funds for fresh water in uganda
text: an african village is able to drink fresh water for the first time thanks to the fundraising efforts of a school in ruddington .
teachers sally squires and jane henson from james peacock school are behind the project .
in 2016 the pair visited uganda and since then have been fundraising for a village , helping pay for a new school building , a teacher and daily breakfast for pupils .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: derby city council to appoint interim chief executive
text: christine durrant is to be interim chief executive of derby city council when paul robinson leaves in march .
the council 's former finance boss , don mclure , is set to come back on an interim basis too .
mr robinson is leaving the authority to become worcester city council 's new chief executive .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: city road turns a shade of green
text: part of a city centre road has been painted teal in a bid to reinforce driving restrictions there .
leicester city council decided to introduce restrictions on horsefair street in january in a bid to tackle congestion .
it is closed to all traffic other than buses , hackney cabs and bicycles and the speed limit is 20mph .
drivers caught using horsefair street can be fined up to £ 60 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snow in derbyshire
text: the white stuff 's been falling in north derbyshire .
janice 's patch took this photo in baslow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: park revamp on hold after carillion collapse
text: a £ 4.8m project to restore highfields park to its former glory has been put on hold following the collapse of carillion .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: midlands has 'fastest rising house prices ' in england
text: the midlands saw the fastest growth in house prices over the year to the end of november , official figures show .
property values grew by 7.2 % in the west midlands and 6.4 % in the east midlands , the office for national statistics ( ons ) said .
london saw the slowest growth ( 2.3 % ) among the english regions .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: have you seen stephen down ?
text: officers are concerned for the safety of an elderly man .
stephen down , 67 , has been reported missing since thursday , nottinghamshire police said .
he is from sussex but is believed to be in nottingham now .
he was last seen wearing a cream jacket with a hood , cream trousers and cream jumper .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: two further arrests in loughborough murder probe
text: two more people have been arrested after a man was found in loughborough with a fatal stab wound .
mark swinhoe ( below ) , 38 , from long eaton , derbyshire , died after being discovered on moira street at about 03:20 on sunday .
a woman was also found hurt and was treated for minor injuries to her face .
a 23-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman have been arrested in connection with mr swinhoe 's death , leicestershire police said .
the force would not provide further detail on the arrests , citing `` operational reasons '' .
a 22-year-old man , who was previously arrested on sus of murder , remains in custody .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: food blogger is finalist for national award
text: a food blogger from west bridgford has been shortlisted for a national award .
lucy parker , who has tens of thousands of followers on social media , is a finalist in the food and drink category of the 2018 uk blog awards .
she started her blog lucy & lentils as a student .
lucy - who became a vegan six months ago - said : `` i started my food blog because i could n't cook , that is no exaggeration , i really could n't cook to save my life .
`` it is lovely to see people recreate my recipes and for someone who could n't cook at all and actually have people now doing that and learning to cook through me is so humbling . ''
the winners will be announced at a ceremony in april .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: air ambulance called after man collapses in ripley
text: an elderly man has been taken to hospital after collapsing in oxford street in ripley .
he was treated by police and paramedics in the town centre before being flown to hospital by an air ambulance that landed on the outskirts of the town .
the man 's current condition is n't known .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: photo appeal after man punched in derby bar
text: police want to speak to this person after a man was punched in the face in a busy derby bar just before christmas .
the alleged assault happened at fat cat 's bar in friar gate at about 18:30 on friday 22 december .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man arrested after hospital stabbing
text: man arrested after hospital stabbing

documents.title: mp throup calls on ant & dec to challenge junk food ads
text: erewash mp maggie throup has called on some of britain 's best-loved presenters to speak out against junk food being advertised during programmes they front .
the conservative member made the comments during a westminster hall debate on the effect of junk food advertising on obesity in children .

she said : `` the power of celebrity can not be underestimated so , with that in mind , i 'm calling on household names like simon cowell , ant and dec , dermot o'leary , amanda holden , to take some corporate responsibility , stand up to the broadcast and say they will no longer be used as a hook to sell harmful junk food to our children . ''
an itv spokesman told the bbc in november : `` itv takes its responsibilities in this area very seriously , and we work actively to promote healthy lifestyles on screen . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snow in derbyshire
text: here 's how buxton looks today following last night 's snow .
thanks to big al bluesman for uploading the
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: nobody injured in house blaze
text: fire crews dealing with the blaze at a house in worksop have confirmed nobody was in the building at the time .
nottinghamshire fire and rescue service were called at 10:27 to carlton road where a fire started in a first floor bedroom .
the cause of the fire is not yet known .
10:27 - crews from # worksop , # harworth and # astonpark from @ twitterid attended a house fire at # carltonroad in worksop .
four breathing apparatus , two hose reels and one jet were used to extinguish the fire .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man stabbed outside leicester hospital
text: a 24-year-old man was stabbed outside leicester royal infirmary this morning .
staff and members of the public were also reportedly threatened inside the hospital and equipment was damaged , leicestershire police said .
officers were called to the accident and emergency department at 2:20 where a 20-year-old man was arrested on sus of wounding with intent .
the 24-year-old man remains in hospital where he is stable .
another member of the public received `` superficial '' injuries .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: fire crews dealing with house blaze
text: fire crews are dealing with a blaze at a house in carlton road in worksop .
nottinghamshire fire and rescue service has confirmed the fire started in a first floor bedroom .
they are also being assisted by crews from south yorkshire .
we will update you when we have more information .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: £ 100m paid in five years for nottingham hospitals mistakes
text: two of the region 's hospital trusts were in the top five for medical negligence pay-outs over the past five years , according to data compiled by the bbc .
since 2012 , £ 99,568,150 in compensation has been awarded for mistakes made at nottingham university hospitals , ranking it the third highest for costs in the uk .
meanwhile , £ 92,416,900 was paid for the trust which runs leicester 's hospitals over the same period , putting it fifth .
these figures include payments for historical mistakes .

dr keith girling , medical director at nuh , said : `` nuh is one of the largest providers of acute health care in the country and includes some highly specialised services delivering care to frail , very unwell , or severely injured patients .
`` we recognise we must do all we can to further improve our systems and checks , and to increase our patients ' safety and confidence whilst in our care . ''
when the figures are averaged over the number of procedures carried out by a hospital - to compensate for the size of a trust - nottingham is 73rd on the list and leicester 120th out of 205 .
meanwhile , derby hospitals paid £ 32m in compensation over five years - 84th on the list - which puts it at 184th on the average list .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: man who was fatally stabbed is named by police
text: a murder investigation has been launched after a man was found in a street with a fatal stab wound .
mark swinhoe , 38 , from long eaton , derbyshire , died at the scene at about 03:20 on moira street , in loughborough .
a woman was also found hurt and was treated for minor injuries to her face .
a 22-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder and remains in police custody .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: new home found for record-breaking dog
text: last week we told you about opie , the biggest canine ever looked after by dogs trust loughborough .
the good news is the one-year-old st bernard - who weighs more than 11st and measures 5ft 6in from nose to tail - has been found a new `` suitable and loving '' home by the charity .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: surgery closure to affect thousands of patients
text: a gp surgery in leicester is set to close , leaving 3,000 patients looking for a new practice .
belgrave surgery in loughborough road will shut on 30 april as the partners of the practice are resigning and selling the building .
the leicester clinical commissioning group says it understands patients will be disappointed and concerned by the news but says it 's working to find alternative health care .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: ancient buried village discovered in derby field
text: a 3,000-year-old settlement has been unearthed by `` surprised '' archaeologists near breadsall .
experts from the university of leicester have , so far , uncovered an iron age roundhouse , a ditch and post holes dating on the edge of breadsall hilltop and oakwood .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: new scheme 'stopped £ 280,000 worth of fraud '
text: a new system put in place to prevent vulnerable people being exploited by fraudsters has stopped £ 280,000 in scams since being introduced in nottinghamshire last year , police have said .
the banking protocol , developed with the finance industry and trading standards , makes it easier for bank staff to contact police if they suspect a customer is being scammed .
notts police said the system had flagged up 45 reports since may - nearly always involving elderly people - and stopped fraud worth £ 280,054.50 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snow in derbyshire
text: snow has fallen in north derbyshire overnight .
here 's how it looks in curbar .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: ticket office stays closed after railway station fire
text: ticket machines are all working again at nottingham railway station following friday 's fire but the ticket office remains closed .
east midlands trains said information screens were up-and-running again and the whole car park is open .
temporary customer toilets are still in place after pipes supplying the main toilets were damaged in the blaze .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: lynx farewell flypast will pay respects to fatal crash
text: five lynx helicopters will be flying over leicestershire this afternoon as part of a final fly-past before the aircraft is withdrawn from service .
the route will include tilton on the hill , where a lynx crashed in may 1999 , killing three soldiers from the army air corps .
three people who pulled a fourth soldier from the wreckage were awarded the queens commendation for bravery .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: shop owner fends off armed robber with wasp spray
text: a shop owner from beeston has been reliving the moment she used a can of wasp spray to chase away an armed robber .
shiyam gunawardena said the attacker pointed a gun at her and demanded money at beeston mini market in chilwell road at 11:00 yesterday .
the 46-year-old said : `` i was shocked , but never panicked i grabbed a can of wasp killer . ''
police are still looking for the masked men , who fled on foot towards imperial road .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : bin lorries collect for homeless charity
text: residents in rushcliffe left donations for homeless charity the friary out with the bins .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: man receives £ 2m after misdiagnosis ends in paralysis
text: a man has been paid £ 2m in compensation from the trust that runs derby hospitals after doctors failed to spot a spinal abscess that left him paralysed .
kevin greenfield has waited five years for the pay-out , which he says will allow him to purchase equipment that will help him regain a certain amount of independence .
`` my life 's changed now , there 's lots of things i ca n't do - some of the most basic things in life - but the biggest impact has been on my wife and our relationship .
she 's more my carer these days than my wife , '' he said .
`` the £ 2m can help me recover my life to a large extent .

at the moment it seems like i 'm a pools winner but hopefully i 've got a lot of years to live and i do n't know what the future holds other than i 'm going to need care going forward so i 'm hoping it 's enough , but who knows ? ''

derby teaching hospitals nhs trust said : `` we apologise to mr greenfield for the delay in diagnosis and treatment of his spinal infection when he was admitted to the royal derby hospital in march 2012 .
`` we hope the compensation agreed will enable mr greenfield to secure the assistance he now requires . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: leicester man ruptures throat stifling a sneeze
text: stifling a sneeze by clamping your nose and mouth shut can cause serious physical damage , doctors are warning .
it comes after medics in leicester treated a 34-year-old man who ruptured his throat while trying to stop a high-force sneeze .
the man said he felt a `` popping '' sensation in his neck when it happened and then immediately experienced pain and difficulty swallowing and speaking .
author: BBC News Health

documents.title: latest on the roads
text: apart from the a57 snake pass being closed there does n't appear to be any major issues on roads in our region right now .
highways england says there is congestion in the following areas :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : snow warning for the east midlands
text: it 's going to feel very cold today , with snow falling over higher ground .
author: Jennifer Bartram
Weather presenter

documents.title: snow closes country road
text: a warning to drivers - the a57 snake pass is closed because of the snow .
a57 snake pass is closed due to snow and is n't expected to re-open this morning .
other high routes - including a537 cat & fiddle , a53 leek road , a6024 holme moss - have had snow , but are passable with care .
we gritted primary routes 9pm & 4am and secondary routes at midnight .
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 15th for jan 16 . )
meanwhile everywhere else in the world they just get on with it .
the grit wo n't beat the snow when it comes down this heavily in the showers .
ca n't see the road opening until tomorrow # uksnow
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: join us for today 's live updates
text: hi everyone .
i 'll be bringing you today 's latest news , sport , travel and weather along with maryam qaiser .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
